intro: Astragalus serenoi, commonly known as the Sierra serenoa, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus serenoi is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
